intro: Bossiaea barbarae, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Bossiaea barbarae is a rare species, with limited distribution, and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
